translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The third section
The discussion on what is being liberated
“Is what is liberated liberated?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is part of it liberated and part not?”🔽“No.”

analyzed: eka desam vimutte eka desam a vimuttanti
translated: “Is part of it liberated and part not?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is part of it a stream-enterer and part not?”🔽“No.”

analyzed: eka desam vimutte eka desam a vimuttanti
translated: “Is part of it a stream-enterer and part not?”

“Yes.”🔽“Is part of it one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry, who has obtained it,🔽who has attained it and is living in possession of it, who has attained it by realization in this very life, and part of it not?”🔽“No.”

original: Ekadesaṁ sotāpanno, ekadesaṁ na sotāpanno, ekadesaṁ sotāpattiphalappatto paṭiladdho
analyzed: eka desam sotāpannaḥ eka desam na sotāpannaḥ eka desam sotāpatti phala patto paṭiladdho
translated: “Is part of it one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry, who has obtained it,🔽who has attained it and is living in possession of it, who has attained it by realization in this very life, and part of it not?”

original: adhigato sacchikato upasampajja viharati, kāyena phusitvā viharati, ekadesaṁ na kāyena
analyzed: adhigataḥ sacchikataḥ upasampajja viharati kāyena phusitvā viharati eka desam na kāyena
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Is part of it one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry, who has obtained it,

original: phusitvā viharati, ekadesaṁ sattakkhattuparamo kolaṅkolo ekabījī buddhe aveccappasādena🔽samannāgato dhamme …pe… saṅghe …pe… ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato, ekadesaṁ ariyakantehi
analyzed: phusitvā viharati eka desam satta kkhattu paramaḥ kolaṅkolaḥ eka bījī buddhe avecca ppasādena  samannāgataḥ dhamme pe saṅghe pe ariya kantehi sīlehi samannāgataḥ eka desam ariya kantehi
translated: who has attained it and is living in possession of it, who has attained it by realization in this very life, and part of it not?”🔽“Yes.”🔽“Is part of it one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry, who has obtained it,🔽who has attained it and is living in possession of it, who has attained it by realization in this very life, and part of it not?”🔽“Yes.”🔽“Is part of it one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry, who has obtained it,
who has attained it and is living in possession of it, who has attained it by realization in this very life, and part of it not?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is part of it one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry, who has obtained it,

analyzed: eka desam vimutte eka desam a vimuttanti
translated: who has attained it and is living in possession of it, who has attained it by realization in this very life, and part of it not?”

“Yes.”🔽“Is part of it one who has attained the fruit of stream-entry, who has obtained it,🔽who has attained it and is living in possession of it, who has attained it by realization in this very life, and part of it not?”

original: Ekadesaṁ sakadāgāmī, ekadesaṁ na sakadāgāmī, ekadesaṁ sakadāgāmiphalappatto paṭiladdho🔽adhigato sacchikato upasampajja viharati, kāyena phusitvā viharati, ekadesaṁ na kāyena
analyzed: eka desam sakadāgāmī eka desam na sakadāgāmī eka desam sakadāgāmi phala patto paṭiladdho  adhigataḥ sacchikataḥ upasampajja viharati kāyena phusitvā viharati eka desam na kāyena
translated: some as once-returners, some as not, some as having attained the fruit of once-returner, obtained it,🔽reached it, and were dwelling in it, having penetrated it with their bodies; some as not having penetrated it with their bodies,

“One part is a once-returner, one part is not a once-returner; one part has attained the fruit of once-returner, has obtained it, realized it, and is abiding in it; one part does not have attained the fruit of once-returner, has not obtained it, has not realized it, and is not abiding in it; one part has touched with the body and abides in it, one part has not touched with the body and abides in it?”
“That can’t be said.”

analyzed: eka desam vimutte eka desam a vimuttanti
translated: “One part is liberated, one part is not liberated?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Ekadesaṁ anāgāmī, ekadesaṁ na anāgāmī, ekadesaṁ anāgāmiphalappatto paṭiladdho adhigato🔽sacchikato upasampajja viharati, kāyena phusitvā viharati, ekadesaṁ na kāyena phusitvā🔽viharati, ekadesaṁ antarāparinibbāyī, upahaccaparinibbāyī, asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī,
analyzed: āmantā  eka desam anāgāmī eka desam na anāgāmī eka desam anāgāmi phala patto paṭiladdhaḥ adhigataḥ  sacchikataḥ upasampajja viharati kāyena phusitvā viharati eka desam na kāyena phusitvā  viharati eka desam antarā parinibbāyī upahacca parinibbāyī asaṅkhāra parinibbāyī
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyī uddha sotoaka niṭṭha gāmī eka desam na uddha sotoaka niṭṭha gāmī iti
translated: “One part is a non-returner, one part is not a non-returner; one part has attained the fruit of non-returner, has obtained it, realized it, and is abiding in it; one part does not have attained the fruit of non-returner, has not obtained it, has not realized it, and is not abiding in it; one part has touched with the body and abides in it, one part has not touched with the body and abides in it; one part is a between-death-and-rebirth non-returner, one part is a on-arrival non-returner, one part is a without-striving non-returner, one part is a with-striving non-returner, one part is a stream-enterer headed for a happy destiny, one part is not a stream-enterer headed for a happy destiny?”
“That can’t be said.”

analyzed: eka desam vimutte eka desam a vimuttanti
translated: “One part is liberated, one part is not liberated?”
“Yes.”

original: Ekadesaṁ arahā ekadesaṁ na arahā, ekadesaṁ arahattappatto paṭiladdho adhigato sacchikato
analyzed: ekadesam arahā ekadesam na arahā ekadesam arahatta patto paṭiladdhaḥ adhigataḥ sacchikataḥ
translated: “One part is a perfected one, one part is not a perfected one; one part has attained and acquired and realized the fruit of non-returning, and one part has not attained and acquired and realized the fruit of non-returning;

original: upasampajja viharati, kāyena phusitvā viharati, ekadesaṁ na kāyena phusitvā viharati,🔽ekadesaṁ vītarāgo vītadoso vītamoho …pe… ekadesaṁ sacchikātabbaṁ sacchikataṁ, ekadesaṁ🔽sacchikātabbaṁ na sacchikatanti?
analyzed: upasampajja viharati kāyena phusitvā viharati eka desam na kāyena phusitvā viharati  eka desam vīta rāgaḥ vīta dosaḥ vīta mohaḥ pe eka desam sacchikātabbam sacchikate eka desa  sacchikātabbam na sacchikatanti
translated: one part abides touching with the body the peaceful liberations that transcend forms, and one part does not abide touching with the body the peaceful liberations that transcend forms;

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Vimuttaṁ vimuccamānanti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Uppādakkhaṇe vimuttaṁ, bhaṅgakkhaṇe vimuccamānanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….🔽Na vattabbaṁ—🔽“vimuttaṁ vimuccamānan”ti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Nanu vuttaṁ bhagavatā—🔽“tassa evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccatī”ti.🔽Attheva suttantoti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Tena hi vattabbaṁ—🔽“vimuttaṁ vimuccamānan”ti.

Is it liberated or is it in the process of liberation?”
“Yes.”
“But has it not been said by the Blessed One:

original: “so evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmetī”ti.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti iti
translated: ‘When his concentrated mind is thus purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints’?
“Is there such a discourse?”
“Yes.”
“Well then, you shouldn’t say that it is liberated or in the process of liberation.
“Is there a mind that is in the process of liberation?”
“Yes.”

original: Atthi cittaṁ rajjamānaṁ dussamānaṁ muyhamānaṁ kilissamānanti?
analyzed: atthi cittam rajjamānam dussamānam muyhamānam kilissamānam
translated: “Is there a mind that is defiled, corrupted, and disturbed, and is in the process of being defiled, corrupted, and disturbed?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: nanu rattañceva arattañca, duṭṭhañceva aduṭṭhañca, mūḷhañceva amūḷhañca, chinnañceva achinnañca, bhinnañceva abhinnañca, katañceva akatañcāti?
analyzed: nanu rattañca iva a rattañca duṭṭhañca iva a duṭṭhañca mūḍhañca iva a mūḍhañca chinnañca iva a chinnañca bhinnañca iva a bhinnañca katañca iva a katañca ati
translated: “But is there a mind that is both expanded and unexpANDED, corrupted and uncorrupted, confused and unconfused, shackled and unshackled, broken and unbroken, split and unsplit, done and undone?”🔽“Yes.”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Hañci rattañceva arattañca, duṭṭhañceva aduṭṭhañca, mūḷhañceva amūḷhañca, chinnañceva achinnañca, bhinnañceva abhinnañca, katañceva akatañca, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci rattañca iva a rattañca duṭṭhañca iva a duṭṭhañca mūḍhañca iva a mūḍhañca chinnañca iva a chinnañca bhinnañca iva a bhinnañca katañca iva a katañca no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Is it that the mind is liberated while being both defiled and undefiled, both deluded and undeluded, both broken and unbroken, both split and unsplit, both done and undone?
Or is it that the mind is liberated while not being either defiled or undefiled, neither deluded nor undeluded, neither broken nor unbroken, neither split nor unsplit, neither done nor undone?”
The Discussion of Liberation is finished.
